|Title=Know the main additional tests to assess the impact of infectious diarrhoea on the health of adults and children.
|Description=None
|Section=Complementary examinations
|Contributors=Alexis de Rougemont,Christophe Deschamps, Johann Cailhol

The impact assessment concerns situations of

* dehydration: blood ionogram, creatininaemia, CBC
* sepsis: blood gas with lactates, assessment of organ dysfunction ([[Acute diarrhoea and dehydration in infants, children and adults|cf item 286]])

question.question: What are the main additional tests to assess the impact of infectious diarrhoea on the health of adults and children?
question.option_a: Blood ionogram, creatininaemia, CBC and blood gas with lactates
question.option_b: Blood gas with lactates, assessment of organ dysfunction and urinalysis
question.option_c: Blood ionogram, creatininaemia, CBC and urinalysis
question.option_d: Blood gas with lactates, assessment of organ dysfunction and creatininaemia
